name: Hotel Alimandi Vaticano

reviews.text: This small hotel was perfect for our family. The room was spacious with 2 queen sized beds. There was a built-in closet with plenty of space to unpack and even store the suitcases. The bathroom was spotless. The air conditioner worked beautifully.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas are attractive and well maintained. The breakfast was more than plentiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Shame about Rome!

reviews.text: We got the feeling that the hotel was recently redone, because everything was in such good shape.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative is that we had to take taxis to get around, but they were easy to find and reasonably priced....7-8 Euros, even at night.
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Great place in Rome

reviews.text: I have recently returned from Rome.
reviews.title: loved the alimandi

reviews.text: The hotel was certainly 4 star.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were a fair size and well set out.
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.disliked: — A bit remote from the action.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was buffet style and to a high standard.
reviews.title: 30 yards from the Vatican Musuem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were Fantastic and friendly.
reviews.title: Superb Alimandi Vaticano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A well derserved 4 star hotel! Very clean with rooms very comfortable and bathrooms most accomodating. The front desk staff (Irene & Aldo) were most helpful and friendly always with a smile. This is a great location especially if visiting the Vatican & St. Peter's. Follow their advice for avoiding the long lines in the morning! A couple of great restaurants within walking distance:
reviews.title: Don't miss this one!

likes.disliked: — The noisy long lines in the AM at the Vatican

reviews.text: Hostaria dei Bastoni and Piacere Molise. We did a night tour of Rome with Vatican Tours and Beyond and it was a highlight of our trip to Rome
reviews.title: Hotel Alimandi Vaticano - Fantastic

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Alimandi for the last two years at Easter. The staff are polite and very friendly. The hotel is clean and well maintained. Also. it is very accomodating for families as we always take our children (infant included) and they cannot do enough for us. I recommend this hotel if you want to be near Vatican City and the Basillica as they are only a short walk away. We will be stopping there next year.
reviews.title: Wonderful small hotel

likes.liked: — Great modern rooms and public areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great small, modern, full-service European hotel. Our family of 4 had 2 rooms for 4 nights in mid-June and we loved it. Rooms are relatively large, service wonderful, very good breakfast, great bar and lounge area, clean and bright rooms and public areas, free Internet access, and wonderful desk staff that gave great advice about things like restaurants and how to avoid huge lines for museums and sites (for example, they told us that the best time to visit the Vatican Museums/Sistine Chapel-- right across the street from the hotel-- was at 1 pm, and they were exactly right-- zero line, versus a 6-block line in mid-morning. The location is unbeatable for the Vatican; further from most other sites, but within easy taxi or subway access. We loved our stay.
reviews.title: After extensive research..........

reviews.text: After extensive research, my partner and I booked into the Alimandi in vaticano for a 5 days trip in april 2007. If you have already spent many hours looking for somewhere good to stay then stop looking - you need to stay here.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This beautiful hotel has everything you need or want to make your vacation special. Our room was lovely, the bathroom large and modern, and the staff very friendly and helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, and any specific needs. The breakfast buffet is delicious and includes a wide assortment of food to satisfy everyone. Transportation is convenient with bus lines and the Metro within walking distance and a taxi stand located opposite the front door of the hotel next to the entrance to the Vatican Museum. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.liked: — We liked everything about this facility.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on a 5 night stay , and loved every minute of it. The hotel is really great for exploring all the major sites nearby, coloseum, vatican ,trevi fountain, spanish steps all about 10 to 20 minute walks. I researched hotels Through on line booking system RoomsAccomodation.com for hours before choosing this one and got a huge rate discount compared to calling the hotel directly. We spent five days here with 100% satisfaction of every individual, service, and product at this hotel. We have very high expectations of service and we all have been impressed with this staff. The concierge made dinner reservations for us and recommendations for sight seeing ( Carrani Tours ). We only used the metro once, to get to the San Giovanni. Apart from that we walked everywhere, to and from all the sights.
reviews.title: We spent five days here with 100% satisfaction
Absolutely wonderful!!!
reviews.text: January is a great time to go in Rome - the weather is sunny although there were lots of people it didn't feel too crowded. I can't imagine what the Vatican must be like in summer though! The area around the hotel is safe. In fact all Rome feels very safe, apart perhaps from the area immediately next to the Termini Station late at night, which still is not all that bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two final notes:
reviews.title: Great location !

likes.disliked: — The view from room was restricted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1st: Rome is a woderful place and upon leaving we were really hoping we would be able to return there on day soon.
reviews.title: fantastic Hotel

description: The Jewel in the Alimandi’s family crown, opened in 2002 this fantastic structure offers luxury rooms and suites facing the entrance to the Vatican museums. All the rooms are stylishly decorated in the liberty style and offer all the modern conveniences one would expect from a hotel of its quality and reputation. The extensive hot and cold buffet breakfast is served in the ground floor breakfast room, while there is a roof terrace with views over the Vatican walls available for special occasion, or simply to catch a little sun. There is the usual extensive concierge service at the reception.
